part.line: The blonde one looks suspicious.
part.narration: Jacques glares at The Administrator. JJ stands next to Asami. Asami holds her head.
part.line: The blonde one is my daughter.
And she's Japanese?
She wasn't born in Japan and she wasn't raised in Japan and she doesn't speak Japanese but—
She's French.
part.narration: Zoom out.Yuki, in the distance, looks around. Signs are in Japanese. Voices are in Japanese. People are in Japanese. Unable to read the magazines, she continues to prod at the toddler toys on the too-small table. A four-year-old observes the girl away from her natural habitat.Yuki is standing a distance from the table at the start of the scene, but the table is brought to the player's attention. The Player can pick up and walk around with one of these toys. The Main Action is whatever action be appropriate to these foreign toys.
part.line: France, huh? Our government's been working on nuclear energy agreements with France.
Good for the government.
Look, Mister — uh —
Shimizu.
Shimizu, I have a lot of business to do and my kids have a lot of symbols to learn.
part.narration: Jacques produces a slip of paper.
part.line: I'm on visa with Sega Enterprises, and my wife's a Japanese citizen.
Fine, we get it, you're legal. May we speak to the girl?
Her name is Yuki.
part.narration: Player walk Yuki to the room.Yuki walks over to The Administrator.
part.line: What happened to your hair?
I was born.
Where in?

choice.line: It is very crazy in Tokyo, yes?
I don't know what's worse, an Osakan or a liar.
choice.narration: The parents are looking away. Excepting Yuki, no ear is turned to the mouth of The Administrator.

choice.line: Sorry if my hair is wrong.
"Wrong?" Wow, if only our students with less natural follicles thought the same.
Don't worry, we will correct your hair.

part.line: Soleil family, we have the cure for what ails your daughter.
part.narration: Jacques and Asami turn around. The Administrator continues.
part.line: If Yuki enrolls at this school, she will be the only blonde in a class of 300.
She'll look too different; she'll stick out.
We believe that no child's development should be harmed by their outlandish appearance.
part.narration: The Administrator pulls out a bottle. He blows it off. He strokes it gently. He gazes at it and begins to whisper.
part.line: Black Beauty. We haven't been together since 1984.
Alas, we again cross paths with a French girl—
We strongly suggest that Yuki dye her hair black. Remember:
Change is optional. Acceptance is not.

narration.comment: The phrase echoes as the scene ends. Flashes of scenes of Yuki's common social interactions as she goes home and spends her first weekend in Japan violently sudden-cut between each other for a period of time:

part.narration: Yuki is on an empty train. It's crowded.
Yuki is on a busy street. It's lonely.
Yuki is at a restaurant. Her mother pushes the food in her face.
part.line: Eat.
part.narration: Yuki kneels at the table of the house. Her mother pushes food in her face.
part.line: Eat.
part.narration: JJ and Yuki meet their father at work.
Yuki watches television. Some show about kids who catch monsters.
Yuki went the whole weekend with nary a drop of dye.Sudden cut to the bathroom at Yuki's house.
